Below is the usual end-of-month summary of returns for major asset classes and assets.
August was a relatively good, albeit bumpy, month for investors overall, thereby extending the year-to-date gains in many markets.
Stocks led the pack, particularly China, the Dow, and Japan. Gold also saw notable gains.
Of the items covered, only Bitcoin and oil registered negative returns for the month.

But why are gold prices rising? Because BRICS is stacking gold bricks, and the Russian sanctions eroded the store-of-value function of the dollar.

And why did the Fed hike rates and devalue Treasuries? Because inflation was eroding the purchasing power of the dollar.

Or the dollar almost halving.

The true rate of inflation is the rate at which the smart money is exiting the US dollar for hard money.

It is a huge deal, because in 1950 America made things while in 2025 it only prints things.

Specifically, the only two globally competitive exports of the US are (a) the dollar and (b) tech.

And tariffs, sanctions, trade war, and printing are eroding the dollar.

Recall the Fed admitted that a ‚Äúsmall number‚Äù of countries were switching to gold.

But that small number actually included Russia, India, and China: the RIC of BRICS.

Digital gold is becoming the reserve currency of the individual.

Gold is returning as the reserve currency of the state.

Original post below.
The dollar is losing reserve currency status. It‚Äôs down to 42% of global reserves, and gold is rapidly rising.

IMO people who called network states "colonialist" are wrong and misguided.

We've seen a lot of large-scale colonialist evil the past few years. Almost none has come from network state exit libertarians, while a lot has come from people who decided libertarianism is outdated now

"If you disagree with how things are run, go start a new thing" really is a very "robust-to-error" position to take. The potential negative consequences of what you do are localized, and are inherently bounded. Even though with the internet you can act globally you're taking a large handicap on network effects. AI doom will NOT come from an island or a boat in international waters. And much of what we're recently seen is some former libertarians realizing "why oppose the government when you can just take it over", which has MUCH LARGER downsides.

I think we should update on this, and be kinder to the "exit" position going forward.

Caveat: I think there is evil that has recently come from libertarians, notably from political lobbying, both for "bad deregulation" (eg. I oppose deregulating AGI/ASI) and for "deregulation no matter the side effects of how you achieve the outcome". But the people doing these things are specifically not the "exit" faction.

Nine former CDC directors who served under Republican and Democratic presidents warn that the damage RFK Jr is doing to America's public health system is "unlike anything our country has ever experienced."

The American protein craze seems to hinge on a biological misunderstanding. 

Yes, muscles are "made of protein." But it doesn't follow that more protein always = bigger muscles. 

There is no way to store excess protein in the body, and the more protein we take in beyond what can be used that day, the more is wasted.

"You can eat a ton of protein. You can digest a ton of protein. But the key question is: How much can you use? And we don‚Äôt have a way of stocking away extra amino acids.‚Äù
Railless light rail is actually a great idea, the best part about light rail isn‚Äôt the rail but the form factor and right of way and stations.

> "twice as fast as solana"

i) wrong, this deliberately takes the concept of shreds from Solana and then compares them to the concept of blocktimes instead. if you compared them to shreds, then solana is 30-50ms faster. in fact, I did this test this week

importantly, it is faster while not being a centralized server

ii) even if you compared them to finality for example, solana with alpenglow will have finalization with a global validator set in 100ms, which is 2x faster than a centralized multisig

read that again ^. Solana will reach finality with thousands of nodes and censorship resistance TWO times faster than a centralized server 

> re sequencers

jito's BAM provides all the same benefits as what luke says but actually on the L1 and in a permissionless way where one giant corp doesn't fully control the sequencer, which is no different than tradfi

> re 80-90% being "extracted". 

i) that's not even close to the actual number, just made up

ii) the actual number has been steadily declining over time as engineers all over the ecosystem are solving the hard problems instead of giving up on all blockchain ideals and saying let's just use centralized servers instead ‚Äî ppl are literally iterating on market structure with prop AMMs and giving better spreads than 0.5bps 

that said I agree that solana technically has the highest amount of retail "extraction", since it does have the most retail and activity. and just like every other time, we will solve the hard problems and make the experience better than all others
